question: Question_01_(a)
statement:
\emph{Determine whether the following statement is true or false. If it
is true, provide justification. If it is false, provide a
counterexample.}

\textbf{(a)} If $f$ is a polynomial of degree greater than 1, then $f$ has a
tangent line that crosses the \emph{x}-axis.
sols:
This statement is \textbf{true}.

If $f$ has no tangent line that crosses the \emph{x}-axis, then all
tangent lines must have slope 0. Hence $f$' = 0 at every point, and thus
the polynomial $f$ is necessarily constant.

This contradicts the assumption we started with. So the statement is
\textbf{true}.
hints:
Assume that the implication of the statement is false. Is it possible
that the assumption holds? In other words, what can you conclude if you
assume that \emph{$f$ has no tangent line that crosses the x-axis}?
